Title: COVID-19- toll-free number dedicated to psychological support for citizens operational
Content: (TAP)- Young volunteer doctors started answering calls to the toll-free number 80105050 that went into operation on Monday for people suffering from anxiety or psychological disorders during the period of general lockdown in the country."The first calls received through this number on Monday showed a considerable number of citizens are suffering from insomnia, lack of appetite, anxiety and permanent stress and panic attacks," Anissa Bouasker, president of the Psychological Assistance Unit for Disaster Victims under the Ministry of Health said in a statement to TAP.She added that 200 psychologists, psychiatrists and medical practitioners are mobilized on a voluntary basis to provide free psychological assistance."We have been active for a few hours now and we have seen a large influx of calls to this toll-free number," she pointed out.The psychological support unit for disaster victims provides the necessary accompaniment of citizens during the period of general lockdown to refer them, if necessary, to specialists, she added.

Title: Tunisia ready to join UNESCO's "Open Science" initiative against COVID-19
Content: (TAP) – Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research Slim Choura, on Monday, took part in an international meeting of representatives of ministries in charge of science all over the world hosted by UNESCO on March 30.The objective of the meeting was to exchange views on the role of international cooperation in science and increased investment in the context of COVID-19.It aims to share expertise on approaches to support the role of science and technology in decision-making and to present various mechanisms and measures taken at the level of each country to fight the COVID-19 pandemic and its repercussions," said a statement from the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research.Emphasis was placed on the importance to mobilise international support for a joint initiative on the adoption of "open science" and international scientific cooperation, in the context of this unprecedented global crisis.Shoura stressed the importance of using science and technology for the benefit of humanity and the necessity to adopt new approaches, based on cohesion and complementarity between countries in the scientific field.He called for lifting the barriers hindering the adoption of open science.He also presented the initiatives undertaken in Tunisia to support remote teaching and finance joint research projects to counter the coronavirus, expressing Tunisia's willingness to engage in the Open Science Initiative.The meeting brought together 122 countries and 77 ministers responsible for scientific research, according to the UNESCO.

Title: Coronavirus: UGTT calls for paying more attention to Tunisians abroad
Content: (TAP) - The Tunisian General Labour Union (UGTT) called on the Ministries of Foreign Affairs and Social Affairs as well as diplomatic missions to strengthen the supervision of Tunisians abroad following the spread of the coronavirus in many parts of the world.It also called in a statement Monday to show more interest, particularly, for Tunisians living in regions where there is no official diplomatic representation by seeking to closely monitor the difficult situation in which they find themselves, guide them and provide social and health support for them.The Union urged the Government to mobilise the additional funds needed to enable diplomatic missions to fulfil their role towards Tunisians living abroad who need support and assistance in these difficult times.It also called on the government to urge host countries, including those that do not have bilateral agreements with Tunisia, to ensure that Tunisian emigrants can benefit from social security cover and humane treatment during this global health crisis.The UGTT also called on the government to create a website and database to communicate with Tunisians abroad and provide them with the necessary assistance in health and social orientation, stressing the importance of networking with immigration organisations and associations.It also called on the Tunisian government to provide the necessary assistance to foreign nationals residing in Tunisia, including students and regular immigrants, by providing them with accommodation, food and the necessary support.Tunisians residing abroad, including students, have in recent days launched distress calls on social media due to the deterioration of their social conditions following the quarantine imposed in several endemic areas in the world including France, Italy and Spain.

Title: Resumption of classes depends on developments of health situation, Saied and Fakhfakh agree at meeting
Content: (TAP) – The resumption of classes in all educational institutions will depend on the developments of the health situation in the country during this period of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, it was agreed at a meeting between President of the Republic Kais Saied and Prime Minister Elyes Fakhfakh Monday at the Carthage Palace.Saied advocated speed and efficiency of interventions to protect all Tunisians, especially the poor people, said a Presidency statement.The meeting also reviewed the general situation in the country as well as the measures taken in all sectors and those likely to be taken in the future, in accordance with the development of the health situation.Emphasis was placed on the need to ensure coherence and complementarity between all state institutions in taking all necessary measures.

Title: China willing to support Tunisia's efforts in fighting COVID-19
Content: (TAP) – Health Minister Abdellatif Mekki, on Monday, met Chinese Ambassador to Tunisia Wang Wenbin, who said his country is willing to strengthen partnership with Tunisia in the health sector and to support its efforts in the fight against the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.During the meeting, the Chinese ambassador said his country is ready to provide the necessary material support (equipment and medical supplies) to help Tunisia fight the COVID-19, said a statement of the Health Ministry.The meeting also focused on ways to complete and equip the new hospital in Sfax, funded by a Chinese donation.

Title: “Psychologists and lawyers should provide voluntary support to families in general lockdown” (Radhia Jeribi)
Content: (TAP) - President of the National Union of Tunisian Women (French: UNFT) Radhia Jeribi called on psychotherapists and lawyers to provide assistance and psychological counseling to families, voluntarily and free of charge, during this period of the coronavirus and general lockdown.   Speaking to TAP, Jeribi said a toll free number was made available since last week so as to answer all women's enquiries and help them during the lockdown by offering them free legal advice.«About 20 calls bout verbal violence between couples due to stress caused by the lockdown have been received by UNFT,» she pointed out, warning against the increase of domestic violence.

Title: Fakhfakh chairs working session on measures to complete school and academic year
Content: (TAP) - A ministerial working session was held on Monday in the presence of Premier Elyes Fakhfakh and the ministers of Education and of Higher Education and Scientific Research.The meeting focused on ongoing preparations for the completion of the school and academic year, as part of measures to be adopted on the health situation in the country and the decision to be taken on ending or extending the general lockdown period, the Prime Ministry said in a press release Monday.Both ministers presented the possible scenarios in case of continuing classes through virtual platforms and TV channels.The ministers further presented an overview on consultations made with social stakeholders and experts regarding the best procedures to complete the school year.To this end, the PM pointed out the need to complete the school and academic year in full conformity with the principle of equal opportunities.It is imperative to organise the national tests in the best health, security and social conditions, Fakhfakh indicated.

Title: COVID-19: thirty-four more confirmed cases in Tunisia, bringing total to 312
Content: (TAP) - Thirty-four new confirmed COVID-19 cases were reported on Sunday in Tunisia, bringing the overall number to 312, announced the Health Ministry.Since the spread of the virus, 3,305 samples were taken, the ministry added in a press release.The number of deaths did not rise: eight were announced on Saturday evening (3 in Sfax, 1 in Sousse, 1 in Ariana, 1 in Kef, 1 in Mahdia and 1 in Tataouine).Sunday's confirmed infections follow test results which came positive out of 536 samples in Charles Nicolle hospital (287 samples) and Pasteur Institute (249).   The geographical distribution of the 312 confirmed cases over 21 governorates is as follows: Tunis (79), Ariana (44), Ben Arous (29), Médenine (19), Sousse (25), Monastir (25), Bizerte (21), Kébili (15), Sfax (11), Manouba (09), Nabeul (08), Tataouine (06), Kef (06), Tozeur (06), Gabès (04), Mahdia (05), Sidi Bouzid (03), Kairouan (02), Zaghouan (02), Gafsa (01) and Kasserine (01).The number of Tunisian nationals who were repatriated and placed in mandatory self-quarantine reached 18,305, figures released on March 28 show. 12,177 completed the quarantine period, while the remaining 6,128 are still in self-isolation under daily medical supervision.The ministry said, in this vein, the pandemic's evolution is a "telltale sign that the virus is spreading rapidly  in several regions of the country" hence the need to "abide by self-quarantine and general lockdown which are key preventive measures to contain the spread of COVID-19.." Citizens are called to fully observe the law and shoulder their collective responsibility by complying with health protection measures.

Title: COVID-19: thirty-four more confirmed cases in Tunisia, bringing total to 312
Content: (TAP) - 34 more confirmed cases of infection with COVID-19 have been reported on Sunday in Tunisia, bringing the overall number to 312, announced the Health Ministry.

Title: Plan for protection of health personnel, set up
Content: (TAP)-A plan to protect health professionals against COVID-19 has been set up, the Health Ministry announced at the end of a working session on Sunday devoted to this issue.The working session, chaired by Health Minister Abdellatif El Mekki, was attended by the heads of occupational medicine and occupational diseases departments in university hospitals, the director of the Labour and Occupational Diseases Institute and members of the permanent commission on monitoring the spread of coronavirus.The meeting focused on means to protect health professionals and the organisation of stand-by duties in the units in charge of taking care of the sick.Over 100 medics and paramedics in the public and private sectors are currently subject to self-isolation."The number of doctors suffering from coronavirus rose to 4 on Friday," according to the secretary general of the General Health Federation Othman Jallouli.

Title: Legal action will be brought against any person proved to be responsible for spreading false information ( Health Ministry)
Content: (TAP)- The Health Ministry said Sunday that its legal department will prosecute anyone proved to be responsible for spreading rumours and misinformation.This measure is out of keenness to protect the country's health security, the ministry announced in a statement issued on Sunday.All data on the development of the COVID-19 epidemic at the national and international levels are published on the official Facebook page of the ministry, the same source added.The information reported by false accounts and attributed to officials and executives of the ministry, including Director General of the National Observatory of New and Emerging Diseases Nissaf Ben Alaya, are groundless, the statement said.Pages on the social network Facebook have spread information according to which Nissaf Ben Alaya is placed in isolation with the staff of the Observatory following their contamination by COVID-19.

Title: COVID-19: 51 more confirmed cases of infection
Content: (TAP) - 51 more confirmed cases of infection with COVID-19 were recorded in the country bringing the total to 278 out of 2,769 tests carried out so far, Minister of Public Health, Abdellatif Mekki said on Saturday.8 people died so far spread over 6 different governorates including 3 in Sfax. Only one death was recorded in each of the following regions: Sousse, Ariana, Kef, Mahdia and Tataouine.

Title: No coronavirus infection recorded in centres for women victims of violence, children and elderly (minister)
Content: (TAP) – Centres for women victims of violence, centres for child protection and centres of the elderly have seen no cases of coronavirus (COVID-19) infection, Minister of Women, Family, Children and Elderly Affairs Asma Shiri Laabidi declared said Saturday.The Minister told TAP no reports have been made so far regarding coronavirus infections in these centres, indicating that they are permanently monitored and all the precautions have been taken to prevent contagion.Concerning child protection centres, only one is currently operational, housing 14 children, while other children face legal issues and are placed with foster families, she said.

Title: COVID-19: No infections in prisons ( Statement)
Content: (TAP) - Spokesperson for the General Directorate of Prisons and Rehabilitation Sofien Mezguich said no infections with COVID-19 have been reported in prison units throughout the country.In a statement to TAP Saturday, the official recalled that all precautions have been taken in permanent coordination with the Health Ministry to prevent the spread of the virus in prisons, such as the suspension of barrier-free visits. Barrier visits are allowed once a week in addition to the reduction of the number of visitors to only two.Preventive measures also include the reduction of the frequency of receiving "baskets" in response to changes in the health situation. He assured that the penitentiary services sterilise all objects and in return are endeavouring to improve the detention conditions and diversify the food provided to prisoners.He added that medicines and medical equipment (masks, gloves, thermometers) are provided to the prisons for staff and detainees during their travel to the Tribunals.In order to avoid infection, spaces have also been arranged in the prisons of Mornaguia, Mornag, Eddir (Kef), Sousse, Gabes and Sfax to accommodate new detainees. The latter will be placed under observation for a period of 14 days.Regarding activities in prisons, the official said only the workshops for making masks remain open, emphasising that the acquisition of the fabric is done in compliance with the conditions communicated by the Health Ministry.He pointed out that the Mornaguia prison produces 1,000 masks per day.

Title: COVID-19: 240 tests carried out at Pasteur Laboratory on Friday
Content: (TAP) - Two hundred and forty analyses (240) were conducted by the reference laboratory at the Pasteur Institute on samples from suspected coronavirus cases on Friday.The number of samples that reached the institute until Saturday morning reached 130, according to the same source, which expected the number of tests would exceed 250 by the end of the day.The Pasteur Institute said the samples were taken from people suspected of contracting the virus in the south-eastern and south-western governorates. Samples came mainly from the governorates of Sfax, Gafsa, Gabes, Tozeur, Kebili, Medenine and Tataouine, the same source added.The laboratory has started the analysis of samples since March 25. Over 500 tests have been conducted by a team of experts working 24 hours a day. In addition to the team working on the analysis of samples, the institute has also mobilised a research team on the coronavirus, according to the same source.

Title: Interactive platform for psychological assistance to families during lockdown to be launched next week
Content: (TAP)-"An interactive electronic platform ( #familya) will be launched in the coming week to provide advice from psychologists to children and parents during the period of health lockdown," said Minister of(  Women, Family, Children and Seniors Asma Sehiri.In a statement to TAP, the minister indicated that 11 psychologists will be mobilised to answer questions from children, parents and seniors through the platform and provide them with the necessary psychological assistance throughout the day."The ministry is working to exploit this period of health isolation to strengthen the links between family members," emphasized Asma Sehiri, recalling that a toll-free number (1899) has also been made available to families.

Title: COVID-19/AU: Protective equipment and test kits for coronavirus arrive to Tunisia
Content: (TAP) - Tunisia received, on Saturday morning, received 100,000 masks, 20,000 test kits for coronavirus, 741 protective suits and 1,100 medical masks," announced  Director of Public Diplomacy and Information at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Bouraoui Limam. This donation is offered by the African Union (African Centre for Disease Control Africa CDC), the official said.Speaking to TAP, Limam explained that the equipment, which is part of a lot of donations sent to all African countries, was financed by Chinese businessman Jack Ma. "The African Union is carrying on its efforts to further strengthen international support to African countries in the fight against this pandemic," he pursued."Tunisia would like to commend the efforts exerted by the AU and to thank the Jack Ma Foundation and the Ethiopian government for their efforts in the distribution and delivery of this equipment,"  Limam pointed outThe Director of Public Diplomacy and Information also hailed the role played by the Tunisian embassy to Ethiopia in ensuring the timely delivery of the equipment.

Title: Nissaf Ben Alaya denies being placed in self-quarantine with ONMNE staff
Content: (TAP)- In response to a rumour about her possible infection with coronavirus, Director General of the National Observatory for New and Emerging Diseases (ONMNE) Nissaf Ben Alaya denied on Friday on the official facebook page of the observatory, being placed in self-quarantine with the ONMNE staff.  "The Observatory team is mobilised to update all data related to the new coronavirus and coordinate with regional health teams to reinforce prevention and response throughout the day," the statement added.

Title: Sfax: Elyes Fakhfakh enquires about health and safety measures to combat COVID-19
Content: (TAP)- Prime Minister Elyes Fakhfakh said Friday, during a visit to the governorate of Sfax, that "the material and protective equipment are available throughout the territory in prevention of all possible scenarios related to the spread of the Coronavirus". At a press briefing held on this occasion at the department of pneumology at the Hedi Chaker University Hospital in Sfax, transformed into a space for the care of patients suffering from COVID-19, Fakhfakh said that "the situation is currently under control" and that "the real remedy lies in respecting the general health lockdown".  The Prime Minister praised on this occasion the efforts made by health personnel in "this epidemic war that Tunisia is facing", stressing the imperative of providing them with the necessary protection as well as "all the shadow soldiers who are in the front line of the fight against this viral scourge citing, in particular, security, military, transport and municipal workers.Fakhfakh stressed the need to undertake a comprehensive structural reform of the infrastructure of the public health sector in Tunisia, which suffers from several shortcomings that have surfaced during this global health crisis.Moreover, the PM indicated that "it is not necessary for the time being to reserve the new university hospital of Sfax for the admission of contaminated patients, but this does not exclude the possibility of using this structure in case of need.The PM went Friday, to the governorate of Sfax with Minister of Health, Abdellatif Mekki to closely monitor the health situation in the region and to enquire about the health and safety measures implemented in the fight against the spread of Coronavirus.During this visit, Fakhfakh met with the medical and paramedical staff of the region and was briefed on the final preparations of the regional Coronavirus control committee, before visiting the pneumology department at the Hedi Chaker University Hospital. With a capacity of 60 beds, the pneumology department of the Hedi Chaker University Hospital was transformed, during this week, into a service for the care of patients suffering from the Coronavirus whose state of health requires hospitalisation.

Title: Emergency department of Kheireddine Hospital temporarily shut down after detecting coronavirus case
Content: (TAP) - The emergency department of the Kheireddine local hospital in La Goulette, Tunis has been temporarily shut down, on Friday, due to the detection of an infection with coronavirus, said a statement from the hospital.Work will continue normally in the other departments, such as the dialysis and radiology one, as well as the laboratory and the pharmacy.A medical and paramedical team will be in charge of prescriptions, while the medics and paramedics who have had contact with the infected individual were placed in self-isolation, the statement said.The municipality of La Goulette had announced that a sixty-year-old man suffering from diabetes showed up at the emergency department of that hospital seeking medical care, before exhibiting symptoms of the coronavirus.The samples taken from him confirmed, on March 25, he had indeed contracted the coronavirus.A municipal team took charge of sterilising all the hospital department, the statement said.

Title: PM makes inspection visit to Central Pharmacy
Content: (TAP) - Prime Minsiter Elyes Fakhfakh, on Friday, made an inspection visit to the premises of the Central Pharmacy in Ben Arous as part of monitoring work in this establishment and efforts made to ensure the supply of the public and private health sector with medical and preventive equipment needed for the current stage.The PM, who was accompanied by Health Minister Abdellatif El Mekki, inspected the stocks of preventive equipment made available to medics and paramedics as well as those of medicines and personal protective equipment.Fakhfakh said that the State has allocated funds of 300 million dinars dedicated to the purchase of a strategic stock of prevention equipment and medicines for the next months, noting that the required purchases will arrive in the next days.The PM hailed the efforts made by the staff working in the Central Pharmacy, stressing its major role in fighting the spread of the coronavirus.

Title: Tests on medics and paramedics of Meftah Saadallah military clinic negative  (Defence)
Content: (TAP)- The laboratory tests conducted on medics and paramedics of the Meftah Saadallah Street military clinic and on the patients they had contact with them, have turned up negative for coronavirus, the National Defence Ministry said on Friday.  The ministry adds in a press release, that the military clinic will re-open on March 30.The Military clinic was shut down last Saturday for cleaning and disinfection. A medical staff member tested positive for COVID-19, along with one of his family members.  The Defence Department warned the hospital staff of the obligation to submit to self-isolation pending the completion of the necessary medical tests and results.

Title: Mekki-Blome talk: boosting health cooperation between Tunisia and US
Content: (TAP) - Ways to boost cooperation between Tunisia and the United States in various fields, including health were at the heart of a meeting Friday between Health Minister Abdellatif Mekki and Ambassador of the United States in Tunis Donald Blome.They discussed the importance of coordination between the two countries as regards sharing experiences and knowledge to combat the spread of coronavirus and taking care of infected people.Blome reaffirmed, on the occasion, his country's willingness to provide financial and material assistance to Tunisia in order to combat this pandemic and overcome its fall-out on the health and economic sectors.

Title: UGTT, FTDES call for protecting Tunisian migrants in Melilla against COVID-19
Content: (TAP)  - The Tunisian General Labour Union (UGTT) and the Tunisian Forum for Economic and Social Rights (FTDES) voiced in a joint statement their deep concern over the situation of Tunisian immigrants in Melilla. In these exceptional circumstances that the world is experiencing today, following the spread of coronavirus which represents a serious threat to the human life, the UGTT and the FTDES call for the adoption of the maximum number of approaches to protect Tunisian migrants in Melilla, especially since there are women and children among them, the same source said. The Union and the Forum also call for all the necessary preventive measures to be taken to avoid the risk of infection among migrants, in strict compliance with all hygiene standards imposed by the World Health Organisation (WHO), such as sterilisation procedures and maintaining a safe distance between people, in addition to contingency plans to move migrants to places that meet health requirements. In these difficult times, the UGTT and the FTDES affirm their support to the Spanish people and its trade unions and civil society institutions in the wake of this ordeal, the statement specifies.

Title: COVID-19: 30 new confirmed cases, number rises to 227 [Upd 1]
Content: (TAP) - Thirty new infection cases by COVID-19 have been reported till March 26, bringing the overall number of confirmed cases to 227, out of a total of 2,045 carried out tests, according to a Health Ministry press release. They are 55 cases recorded in the governorate of Tunis, 34 (Ariana), 23 (Ben Arous), 14 (Medenine), 17 (Sousse), 17 (Monastir), 11 (Sfax), 11 (Kebili),  06 (Tataouine), 11 (Bizerte), 04 (Gabes) , 04 Mahdia, 03 Manouba, 02 Kairouan, 03 Nabeul, 02 Zaghouan, 01 Gafsa, 02 Kef, 01 Sidi Bouzid, 06 Tozeur, the ministry said. The number of deaths is 06 persons; 01 in Sfax, 01 in Sousse, 01 in Ariana, 01 in Kef, 01 in Mahdia, and 01 in Tataouine, recalls the same source. Some 17,888 persons are in self-quarantine, 8,845 of whom have completed the quarantine period and 9,043 are still in isolation and under daily medical check-ups. The Ministry recalls the imperative to respect hygiene standards and calls on citizens to show responsibility and compliance with the general lock-down so as to combat the spread of coronavirus.

Title: Four governorates still COVID-19 free
Content: (TAP) - Four governorates, namely Beja, Jendouba, Siliana and Kasserine, have so far reported no cases of infection by COVID-19, according to data published on the Prime Ministry's website regarding the development of the health situation in the country.The Gafsa and Kef governorates both reported only one case while the governorates of Kairouan, Nabeul and Zaghouan each reported two cases, the same source specifies. The number of cases reported in other governorates varies between 3 and 7 cases, with the exception of 5 governorates where the number of infection cases has surpassed 12. The Tunis governorate reported 52 cases, followed by Ariana (33) and Ben Arous (17).The Health Ministry announced in a press release issued Thursday night the identification of 24 new infection cases, out of 309 conducted tests.

Title: COVID-19: 24 new confirmed cases, number rises to 197 (Mekki)
Content: (TAP) - The total number of people contaminated with COVID-19 throughout the country has risen to 197 with 24 new confirmed cases, according to a new assessment announced Thursday evening by Minister of Public Health Abdellatif Mekki. In a statement to private television channel Carthage+, Mekki said the new cases tested positive, out of a total of 308 tests carried out, citing official data provided in coordination with the National Observatory of New and Emerging Diseases. The minister said the tests were carried out in the laboratories of the Charles Nicolle Hospital and the Pasteur Institute in Tunis. According to a Health Ministry press release, the 197 confirmed cases are among 1,763 tested persons. Since the spread of the pandemic in the country, 5 deaths due to the COVId-19 were recorded in 5 different governorates, namely Ariana, Kef, Mahdia, Sfax and Sousse. Geographically, the 197 confirmed cases are spread over 18 governorates. The highest number of cases were reported in Greater Tunis with 105 cases shared out between Tunis (52), Ariana (33), Ben Arous (17) and Manouba (3). The remaining cases were reported in Sousse (16), Monastir (14), Medenine (14), Sfax (11), Kebili (11), Tataouine (6), Bizerte (4), Gabes (4), Mahdia (4), Kairouan (2), Nabeul (2), Zaghouan (2), Gafsa (1) and Kef (1). According to the ministry, the monitoring measures of Tunisian repatriates helped till March 25, place 17,859 persons in self-quarantine, 7,692 of whom completed their quarantine period and the remaining 10,167 are still under health control nationwide. The ministry reiterated call for the Tunisians to comply with the hygiene and protection measures against COVID-19.In this difficult health situation, the ministry "relies on the awarness of the citizens and urge them to shoulder their collective responsibility by complying with the general lock-down measures."

Title: "No financial constraints that prevent payment of social subsidies" (Habib Kchaou)
Content: (TAP) - Social Affairs Minister, Habib Kchaou, told a plenary session held Thursday at the House of People's Representatives (HPR), that the setting of the date of March 30 for the payment of social allowances to their beneficiaries is due to strictly organisational, logistical and technical reasons, and not to the lack of funds.Kchaou said that the government has mobilised funds worth 150 million dinars to distribute them to about 900 thousand families, as well as 350 million dinars for the benefit of workers threatened by technical unemployment".He mentioned the approval of a specific increase of 50 dinars per allowance, for the benefit of 260 thousand poor families who have already received their allowances. Consultations are underway with the Tunisian Post Office for the payment of specific allowances for the benefit of 623 thousand families in the amount of 200 dinars per allowance, from March 30 .Kchaou also stressed that "there is no financial constraint that prevents the payment of subsidies to workers laid off in the context of technical unemployment. These subsidies will be paid once the procedures are completed and successively depending on the receipt of new applications, he explained.He stressed that all these measures were adopted "in record time, shortly after the decision of general lockdown in prevention against the Coronavirus", praising the efforts made by the Tunisian administration to iron out the difficulties that hamper the payment of social subsidies.
